result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

8:57 AM Defendant James Martin Plucinski appeared by video.  Attorney Heidi E. Brewer appeared by video for James Martin Plucinski.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.   Court indicates DEF appears by zoom without approval by court.  Attny Brewer makes statement as to appearance by DEF.   Court addresses DEF, DEF responds as to his appearance.  Court reviews the Justice Point violation report.   DEF makes statement.   Court reads the bond conditions.   Court instructs DEF must appear in person, and resets initial appearance.  If DEF does not appear, warrant will be issued.  Court reset.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 11:00 am.

($500 posted 8/18/2022)  DEF MUST POST ADDITIONAL $500 CASH.   Combined Bond 21CF240, 22CF140, 22CM132  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. DEF must post additional $500.    Attny Otten request initial appearance to be set.   Warrant quashed.
